title: What do people who believe in reincarnation think happens to people like Hitler and Stalin after death? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to Buddhists and others who believe in reincarnation, souls are never really annihilated, only reused. Also, I think you have to distinguish between someone his Stalin, who was a brutal dictator, and Hitler, who tried to wipe out an entire race of people. Hitler would probably have to go someplace where he could think about what he did in his previous lifetime. It wouldn't necessary be a place of eternal torment like the Christians believe, but he would definitely need a long time-out. Once he had done that, he would probably be reborn into a life where he could further learn the lessons he needed to learn. He might come back as an immigrant or a member of a minority someplace where those kinds of people are despised, so he would learn first-hand what it feels like to be hated.

I don’t know exactly but logically to Stalin should happen the same as to Saddam Hussein who was also a dictator who built pretty livable stable Iraq, and to Hitler should happen the same as to US presidents who destroyed Iraq. Six US Presidents Have Destroyed Iraq by Chris Ernesto Posted onJuly 04, 2014 It doesn’t take a PhD in Sociology to conclude that Iraq was better off with Saddam Hussein than it is today. It’s not that Saddam was a great leader without blood on his hands. It’s just that what six US presidents have done to Iraq over the past 35 years has been much worse than anything Saddam ever did to the people of Iraq.
